solution: (a) As Proud and Arrogant are synonyms of each other, similarly Authentic and Genuine are synonyms of each other.

question: If 3 April 1996 was Wednesday, then what was the day of the week on 7 April 2001 ?
solution:
(a)
3 April 1996 is Wednesday. On going to 3 April 2001 number of odd days are
+1 + 1 + 1 + 2 + 1 = 6. We have reached till 3 April 2001, we have to reach 7 April, number of days between = 4. Total number of odd days = 6 + 4 = 10.On dividing 10 by 7 remainder = 3. Wednesday + 3 = Saturday.

10 years ago, a man‚Äôs age was 5 times of his son‚Äôs age. 2 years hence, twice his age will be equal to 4 times the age of his son. What is the present age (in years) of the son?
solution:
(a)
Let the present age of the man and his son be 5x + 10 and x + 10
According to the question
2(5x + 10 + 2) = (x + 10 + 2)4
(5x + 12) = (x + 12)2
5x - 2x = 24 - 12
3x = 12, x = 4
Hence, the present age of the son = 4 + 10 = 14 years

question: The All India Kabaddi Federation came into existence in the year ____________ and compiled standard rules.
solution:
(d) 1950.
Kabaddi is a combative sport played with seven players on each side. The players on the defensive side are called "Antis," while the player on the offense is known as the "Raider." Kabaddi Federations and Establishment Years : Amateur Kabaddi Federation of India (AKFI) was established in 1972, International Kabaddi Federation was founded in 2004, with its headquarters in Jaipur.

question: Which ministry declared 2025 as the "Year of Reforms"?
solution: (b) Ministry of Defence. This decision was unanimously taken during a meeting chaired by Rajnath Singh, with the objective of transforming the triservices into a technologically-advanced combatready force capable of multi-domain integrated operations. The Department of Defence became the Ministry of Defence under a Cabinet Minister in August 1947.

question: This famous classical dancer and choreographer is known for popularizing the Odissi dance form and founding the Nrityagram dance village. Who is she?
solution: (b) Protima Gauri. Sanjukta Panigrahi (Odissi) : Awards - Padma Shri (1975), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1976). Sonal Mansingh (Bharatanatyam and Odissi) : Awards - Padma Bhushan (1992), Padma Vibhushan (2003). Rukmini Devi Arundale (Bharatanatyam) : Awards - Padma Bhushan (1956), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1957).

question: Who of the following was famous for Punjabi folk song and for singing a long breathless alaap?
solution: (b) Gurmeet Bawa. She was known as Lambi hek di malika. She was the first Punjabi female singer to sing on Indian public service broadcaster, Doordarshan. Award: Padma Bhushan (2022).

question: In any tennis game, if both players win three points each in a game (i.e. score is 40-40), then it's called a _______ .
solution: (b) Deuce. Tennis scoring system - A player or team has to win 4 points to win a game. Any game starts at 0-0 and the zero point in tennis is called love. The progression of points occurs as follows: First point - 15, Second point - 30, Third point - 40, Fourth point - Game. After deuce, the player who wins the next point has advantage.

question: Which of the following is the highest award for dance in India?
solution: (d) Sangeet Natak Akademi Award is given by the Sangeet Natak Akademi and was first awarded in 1952. It consists of a cash prize of ‚Çπ1,00,000, a citation, an angavastram (a shawl), and a tamrapatra (a brass plaque). The National Nritya Shiromani Award is given to outstanding dance performers and musicians from India and abroad. The Kalidas Samman is presented by the Government of Madhya Pradesh.

question: Identify the Mughal emperor who was imprisoned for the rest of his life in Agra after the war of succession among his sons.
solution: (c) Shah Jahan (Mirza Shahab-ud-din Baig Muhammad Khan Khurram). He was the fifth Mughal emperor and reigned from 1628 to 1658. Aurangzeb declared himself emperor in 1658 and imprisoned Shah Jahan in Agra Fort until his death in January 1666. Some notable works of Shah Jahan : Red fort of Delhi, Taj Mahal, The Jama Masjid of Delhi, The Pearl Mosque (Moti Masjid) of Agra, The Peacock Throne etc.

question: In which Indian state is the 'International Lusophone Festival' hosted?
solution: (b) Goa. The International Lusophone Festival seeks to strengthen India‚Äôs connection with the Lusophone world (Portugeese-speaking people). Goa has historical ties to the Lusophone world and Portuguese cultural institutions. Famous festivals of Goa : Goa Carnival, Fatorpa Zatra, Three Kings Feast, Easter, Shigmo, Shirgao Jatra, Sao Joao Festival, Sangodd, and Chikalkalo.

question: All India Kisan Sabha was founded in 1936 at Indian National Congress (INC) ________ Session as All India Kisan Congress.
solution: (a) Lucknow. Swami Sahajananda Saraswati, who founded the Bihar Provincial Kisan Sabha in 1929, also led the formation of the All India Kisan Sabha (AIKS) during the Indian National Congress' Lucknow Session in 1936. The AIKS, also known as the Akhil Bharatiya Kisan Sabha.

question: According to the data from the Ministry of Mines, the largest resources of gold ore (primary) are located in which of the following Indian states?
solution: (b) Bihar. In India, the largest resources of gold ore (primary) are located in Bihar (44%) followed by Rajasthan (25%), Karnataka (21%), West Bengal (3%), Andhra Pradesh (3% ), Jharkhand (2 %).

question: The Office of the Registrar General and Census Commissioner comes under which of the following ministries of Government of India
solution: (b) Ministry of Home Affairs. The Registrar General and Census Commissioner of India is responsible for organizing, conducting, and analyzing the results of the demographic surveys of India, including the Census of India and the Linguistic Survey of India. The Registrar General and Census Commissioner of India was founded in 1961 by the Ministry of Home Affairs as an organization to conduct demographic surveys in India. The position is typically held by a civil servant with the rank of Joint Secretary.

question: Which of the following statements is INCORRECT regarding the Coriolis force?
option_1: It deflects the wind to the right in the north and left in the south.
option_2: It is directly proportional to the angle of altitude
option_3: Deflection is less when the wind is high
solution: (c) Deflection is less when the wind is high. Coriolis force : An apparent force caused by the earth‚Äôs rotation. The Coriolis force acts perpendicular to the pressure gradient force (pressure gradient force is perpendicular to an isobar). It is maximum at the poles and is absent at the equator. The Coriolis force also affects ocean currents.

question: The concept of Public Interest Litigation originated in _______________.
solution: (c) USA. Public Interest Litigation (PIL) means litigation filed in a court of law, for the protection of ‚ÄúPublic Interest‚Äù, such as Pollution, Terrorism, Road safety, Constructional hazards etc. The concept of PIL was initially sown in India by Justice Krishna Iyer, in 1976 in Mumbai Kamagar Sabha vs. Abdul Thai. Any citizen can file a public case by filing a petition: Under Art 32 of the Indian Constitution, in the Supreme Court. Under Art 226 of the Indian Constitution, in the High Court. Under section 133 of the Criminal Procedure Code, in the Court of Magistrate.

question: Which of the following is issued by commercial banks at a discount on face value?
solution: (c) Certificates of deposits are unsecured, negotiable, short-term instruments in bearer form, issued by commercial banks and development financial institutions. Commercial papers - It is issued by large companies for short-term funding at lower interest rates, with maturities of 15 days to one year. Treasury bills - They are short-term government securities maturing in less than one year.

question:
Which of the following statement(s) is/are INCORRECT vis-√†-vis Fundamental Duties?
1) The 44th amendment Act introduced Fundamental duties in the Constitution.
2) Fundamental Duties were expanded by the 86th amendment act.
3) Article 51A (a) entails respect for its ideals and institutions, national flag and the national anthem.
4) Fundamental Duty obliges parents to provide opportunities for education to their child between 6-14 years of age.
solution: (a) 1. The 44th Constitutional Amendment Act of 1978 was enacted to undo many changes made by the 42nd Amendment during the Emergency in India. Key provisions include restoring judicial review, protecting civil liberties, and ensuring that the right to property is no longer a fundamental right but a legal right. Fundamental Duties are added by 42nd Amendment Act 1976. Later on, one more duty was added by 86th Amendment Act, 2002.

question: Which of the following institutions has contributed mainly in improving the economic status of the poor women in rural areas ?
solution: (c) Self-Help Groups are informal associations of people who choose to come together to find ways to improve their living conditions.They help the poor and marginalized by building skills for employment and income generation. SHGs also provide loans without requiring collateral. Indira Awas Yojana: Provides housing subsidies to poor families. Integrated Development Project: A broader rural development initiative. Rural Health Scheme: Focuses on healthcare services.

question: Identify the INCORRECT pair regarding the material media and their refractive index?
solution: (b) Benzene ‚Äì 2.42. The refractive index of an optical medium is a dimensionless number that gives the indication of the light bending ability of that medium. Absolute refractive index of some material media: Benzene - 1.50, Rock salt - 1.54, Carbon disulphide - 1.63, Dense flint glass - 1.65, Diamond - 2.42, Crown glass - 1.52, Turpentine oil - 1.47, Water - 1.33, Alcohol - 1.36, Fused quartz - 1.46, Air - 1.0003.

question: Which article has a similar provision to that of Article 32 and deals with writ jurisdiction?
solution: (d) Article 226. In India, writs are issued by the Supreme Court under Article 32 of the Constitution of India and by the High Courts under Article 226 of the Constitution of India. There are 5 types of writs issued in India - Habeas Corpus (to have the body of), Mandamus (we command), Certiorari (to be certified or to be informed), Prohibition (to forbid) and Quo-Warranto (by what authority or warrant).

question: Which metalloid in the carbon group is chemically similar to its group neighbours tin and silicon?
solution: (a) Germanium (Ge) is a metalloid in the carbon group (Group 14) of the periodic table, and it is chemically similar to its group neighbors tin (Sn) and silicon (Si). This similarity arises because all three elements share similar electron configurations and chemical properties, such as forming covalent bonds and having semiconductor characteristics.

question: Who was the first feudatory of Pallavas ?
solution: (d) Vijayalaya was the founder of the Chola Empire. Simhavishnu was the founder of the Pallava dynasty. The Pallavas established their authority over southern Andhra Pradesh and northern Tamil Nadu, with their capital at Kanchi. Harshvardhan belongs to the Pushyabhuti dynasty.

question: In 1835, who developed the process of applying a thin layer of metallic silver to one side of a clear glass pane and created the first mirror ?
solution: (d) Justus von Liebig. He was a German scientist who made major contributions to the theory, practice, and pedagogy of chemistry, as well as to agricultural and biological chemistry. C.V. Raman: Indian physicist known for his work on light scattering (Raman effect). His Awards: Nobel Prize (1930), and Bharat Ratna (1954). C.H. Townes: American physicist who worked on quantum electronics and lasers. His Award: Nobel Prize (1964). Victor Francis Hess: Austrian-American physicist who discovered cosmic rays. His Award: Nobel Prize (1936).

question: Who passed away in January 2025, known for his work as a poet, journalist, filmmaker, and former Rajya Sabha member?
solution: (a) Pritish Nandy. He authored 40+ poetry books and translated works in multiple languages. His poem "Calcutta If You Must Exile Me" is a modern Indian literature classic.

question: Which dancing form is classified as Ekaharya?
solution: (a) Bharatnatyam. It originated in the temples of South India, particularly, Tamil Nadu. It was traditionally performed by Devadasis, and thus was also known as Dasiattam. Other Facts - Bharatanatyam includes three basic forms - Melattur, Pandanallur and Vazhuvoor. Abhinaya - Facial expressions in Bharatanatyam. Mangalam - End of a dance. Thillana - Final part of a recital. Aramandi - a fundamental dance position in Bharatanatyam that involves half sitting.

question: In an electrical circuit, the ammeter reading decreases to ________________ when the length of the wire is doubled.
solution: (b) one-half. According to Ohm's law, the resistance ùëÖ of a conductor is directly proportional to its length ùëô and inversely proportional to its area of cross-section ùê¥. Doubling the length increases the resistance, which reduces the current, leading to a halving of the ammeter reading. That is, R ‚àù ùëô and R ‚àù 1A. we get R ‚àù 1A or, R = œÅ 1A.

question: Which Indian Grandmaster recently defeated both Magnus Carlsen and Fabiano Caruana in an online blitz competition?
solution:
(b) Arjun Erigaisi
Indian Grandmaster Arjun Erigaisi achieved a remarkable feat by defeating World No. 1 Magnus Carlsen and World No. 2 Fabiano Caruana in the Titled Tuesday weekly blitz competition conducted by Chess.com. Erigaisi finished with 10 points out of 11 rounds, showcasing his exceptional talent in the online chess community.

question: The marked price of a battery-operated rickshaw is ‚Çπ90,000. It is available for sale at two successive discounts of 10% and 5%. What is the selling price (in‚Çπ) of the battery-operated rickshaw?
solution:
(a)
SP of the rickshaw = 90000 √ó 910 √ó 1920 = 76,950

question: If 321y72 is a multiple of 6, where y is a digit, what is the least value of y?
solution:
(b) A number is divisible by 6 if it is divisible by both 2 and 3:
Divisibility of 2 : A number is divisible by 2 if it is an even number,
Divisibility of 3 : A number is divisible by 3 if the sum of all digits of that number is divisible by 3.
Now, 321y72
‚áí3 + 2 + 1 + y + 7 + 2 = 15 + y
The least value of y is 0

question: Two numbers are, respectively, 30% and 60% more than a third number. The ratio of the two numbers is:
solution:
(a) Let third number = 100
Then, two number = 100 √ó 130% = 130 and 100 √ó 160% = 160
Ratio of two numbers = 130 : 160 = 13 : 16

question: For what least value of n, 22n+2n is completely divided by 6, where n is an integer ?
solution:
(b) Given: 22n + 2n
Put n = 3,
‚áí22√ó3+ 2 √ó 3 = 64 + 6 = 70 (not divisible by 6)
Put n = 1
‚áí22√ó1+ 2 √ó 1 = 4 + 2 = 6 (divisible by 6)
Put n = 0
22√ó0+ 2 √ó 0 = 1 + 0 = 1 (not divisible by 6)
Put n = 2
22√ó2+ 2 √ó 2 = 16 + 4 = 20 (not divisible by 6)
It is clear that the correct answer is option (b)

question: 47 masons can dig a 35 m long trench in one day. How many masons should be employed for digging a 105 m long trench of the same type in one day?
solution:
(c)
Let required masons be x
According to the question,
4735 = x105 ‚áí x = 47√ó10535 = 141

question: A 135 m long train crosses a man walking at a speed of 10.6 km/h in the opposite direction in 12 seconds. What is the speed (in km/h) of the train?
solution:
(a) Let the speed of the train be x km/h
Relative speed = (x + 10.6) km/h
According to question,
‚áíSpeed = Distancetime = 13512m/sec = 135 12 √ó 185 = 40.5 km/h
Now,
‚áí(x + 10.6) = 40.5 km/h
‚áíx = 29.9 km/h

question: A man can row a boat at speed 8 km/h in still water. It takes thrice as long to row upstream as it does to row downstream. Find the speed of the stream (in km/h).
solution:
(b) speed of boat = 8 km/h
Let speed of current be y
According to the question,
3 √ó upstream speed = downstream speed
3(8 - y) = (8 + y)
24 - 3y = 8 + y
4y = 16 ‚áí y = 4 km/h

question: If 29 √ó 2 √ó 742 √∑ 2809 = y + 784, then find the value of y.

29 √ó 2 √ó 14 = y + 784
y = 812 - 784 = 28

Student increase % = 993 8000√ó 100 = 12.41%

question: if 7 cos¬≤.Œ∏ + 5 sin¬≤Œ∏ - 6 = 0 , (0¬∞ < Œ∏ < 90¬∞), then what is the value of 1 + sec Œ∏+tan Œ∏ sec Œ∏-tan Œ∏ ?
solution:
(a)
7 cos¬≤ Œ∏ + 5 sin¬≤ Œ∏ - 6 = 0
Let Œ∏ = 45¬∞
7 √ó 12 + 5 √ó 12 - 6 = 122- 6 = 6 - 6 = 0
Now,
1 + sec Œ∏ + tan Œ∏ sec Œ∏ - tan Œ∏ = 1 + sec45¬∞ + tan 45¬∞sec45¬∞ - tan 45¬∞
= 1 + 12 + 1 12 - 1 = 1 + 2 + 1 2 - 1
Now, 1 + 2 +12 - 1√ó2 +12 + 1 = 1 + 2 + 1 = 2 + 2

question: A fraction 3 5 is decreased by 25. The resulting fraction is then increased by 20%. What is the percentage decrease/increase in the value of the original fraction?
solution:
(c)
According to the question,
3 5 - 25 = 1 5
After 20% increment = 1 5 √ó 65 = 6 25
Ratio - initial : final
3 5 : 6 25 = 5 : 2
decrease% = 5-25 √ó 100 = 60%

question: The side BC of ‚àÜABC is produced to a point D. If AC = BC and ‚à†BAC = 70¬∞, then find the value of 2.5‚à†ACD ‚àí 1.5‚à†ABC.
solution:
(a)

In ŒîABC
‚à†A + ‚à†B + ‚à†C = 180¬∞
‚à†ACD = ‚à†A + ‚à†B ‚Ä¶ (exterior angle property)
‚à†ACD = 140¬∞
now,
2.5 √ó ‚à†ACD - 1.5 ‚à†ABC
2.5 √ó140¬∞ - 1.5 √ó 70¬∞ = 350¬∞ - 105¬∞ = 245¬∞

question: A dishonest dealer sells his goods at 20% loss on the cost price but uses a faulty weight that weighs 25% less. His profit or loss percentage (rounded off to 2 decimal places) is:
solution:
(d)
Ratio ‚Üí Initial : Final
price ‚Üí 5 : 4
Weight ‚Üí 3 : 4
-----------------------------------------
Final ‚Üí 15 : 16
Profit % = 115√ó100 = 6.67%

question: In a bank, 6% interest is given on the deposited amount. The bank then invests the money in the stock market and is able to earn ‚Çπ30,000 for every ‚Çπ3,00,000. How much money is the bank earning finally if the total amount deposited in the bank is ‚Çπ60,00,000 ?
solution:
(c) Interest gained by bank on deposited amount = 30000300000 √ó 100 = 10%
Bank give by bank on deposited amount = 6%
Required profit to earn by Bank = 6000000 √ó (10 - 6)% = ‚Çπ240000

question: From a circle with the radius of 15.75 cm, a sector with the arc length of 11 cm is cut off. Find the area (in cm¬≤) of this sector.
solution:
(b)
Area of sector = 12 √ó l √ó r
= 12 √ó 11 √ó 15.75 = 86.625 cm¬≤

question: An equal sum of money was lent to P and Q at 8.6% per annum for a period of 7 years and 8 years, respectively. If the difference in interest paid by them was ‚Çπ172, then the sum lent to each was:
solution:
(a)
For P = 7 √ó 8.6%
For Q = 8 √ó 8.6%
difference (8.6 √ó 1 units) = ‚Çπ172
Required sum (100 units) = 1728.6 √ó 100 = ‚Çπ2000

question: The largest number that can divide 147, 183 and 271 leaving remainders 11, 13 and 16, respectively, is:
solution:
(b) According to question,
147 - 11 = 136, 183 - 13 = 170 and 271 - 16 = 255
136 = 23√ó17
170 = 2√ó5√ó17
255 = 3√ó5√ó17
HCF of (136, 170 and 255) = 17

question: The average weight of 10 students is increased by half a kg when one of the students weighing 51 kg is replaced by a new student. Find the weight of the new student.
solution:
(a) Increase average = 10 √ó 0.5 = 5 kg
So, new student weight = 51 + 5 = 56 kg

question: If sin(X - Y) = sinXcosY - cosXsinY, then the value of sin (A-B)cosAcosB+sin (B-C)cosBcosC:
solution:
(d)
= sin (A-B)cosAcosB+sin (B-C)cosBcosC
= sinAcosB - cosAsinBcosAcosB + sinBcosC - cosBsinCcosBcosC
= cosC(sinAcosB - cosAsinB) + cosA(sinBcosC - cosBsinC)cosAcosBcosC
= sinAcosBcosC - cosAsinBcosC + cosAsinBcosC - cosAcosBsinCcosAcosBcosC
= sinAcosBcosC - cosAcosBsinCcosAcosBcosC
= cosB(sinAcosC - cosAsinC)cosAcosBcosC
= (sinAcosC - cosAsinC)cosAcosC
= sin(A-C)cosAcosC

question:
Parts of the given sentence have been underlined. One of them contains an error. Select the option that has the segment with a grammatical error.
The art historian argued that the painting's value has been greatly underestimated, and that its unique style and technique deserved recognition from the art community and the public alike.
solution:
(b) has been greatly underestimated
The given sentence is in the past tense, so the helping verb of past perfect tense (had) will be used in place of ‚Äòhas‚Äô. Hence, ‚Äòhad been greatly underestimated‚Äô is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the underlined word.
Ramya is an ardent follower of secularism.
solution:
(a) Committed- dedicated or devoted to a cause or activity.
Ardent- having or showing strong enthusiasm or passion.
Forced- done under pressure or obligation.
Unhappy- feeling or showing discontent.
Temporary- lasting for a short period.

question:
Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence. If there is no need to substitute it, select ‚ÄòNo substitution‚Äô.
In yesterday‚Äôs fire accident, her feets are burnt badly.
solution:
(b) her feet were
‚ÄòYesterday‚Äô indicates past tense. ‚ÄòFeets‚Äô is incorrect as ‚Äòfeet‚Äô is the correct plural form of ‚Äòfoot‚Äô. Hence, ‚Äòher feet were‚Äô is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Choose the one which can be substituted for the given words/ sentence :
A person extremely desirous of money
solution:

‚ÄúFervent‚Äù - having or showing great warmth.
‚ÄúExtravagant‚Äù- is spending too much money.
‚ÄúMiser‚Äù - one who doesn‚Äôt spend a lot.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice..
Usnis has not used the computer for weeks.
option_1: The computer did not used by Usnis for weeks.
option_2: The computer has not been used by Usnis for weeks.
option_3: The computer was not been used by Usnis for weeks.
option_4: The computer has not being used by Usnis for weeks.
solution:
(b) The computer has not been used by Usnis for weeks. (Correct)
(a) The computer did not used by Usnis for weeks. (Incorrect tense)
(c) The computer was not been used by Usnis for weeks. (Incorrect tense)
(d) The computer has not being used by Usnis for weeks. (Incorrect tense)

question:
Given below are four jumbled sentences. Pick the option that gives their correct order.
P. Some consider this as an eco-feminist movement where women are actively involved.
Q.An illiterate women Gora Devi a tribal leader from the Chamoli district mobilized the women to protect their forests.
R. So they adopted the Chipko movement which promotes nonviolence.
S. The Bhutiyas knew they had to save their forests.
solution:
(d) SRQP
Sentence S will be the starting line as it contains the main subject of the parajumble i.e. The Bhutiyas, who had to save their forests. And, Sentence R states what they adopted to save it. So, R will follow S. Further, Sentence Q states about an illiterate lady who is the tribal leader and Sentence P states how it was considered as it involved women. So, P will follow Q. Going through the options, option (d) has the correct sequence.

question: Select the correctly spelt word.
solution:
(d) directory
‚ÄòDirectory‚Äô is the correct spelling.

question:
From among the words given in bold, select the INCORRECTLY spelt word in the following sentence.
Almost all the governors of Bengal strongly resented the special privileges enjoyed by English company as it meant a huge loss to the provinciel exchequer.
solution:

Provincial is the correct spelling.

question:
Identify the segment in the sentence which contains grammatical error. Mark ‚Äòno error‚Äô in case the sentence given is correct.
One should respect the religions of others as much as his own .
solution:

Pronoun have used as ‚Äòone‚Äô in the beginning , we do not have to use ‚Äòwith his own‚Äô in part c. Replace ‚Äúhis own‚Äù by one‚Äôs own

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.
Go down in flames
solution:

question:

He absented from the meeting.

question:
Four alternatives are given for the idiom/phrase underlined in the sentence. Choose the alternative which best expresses the meaning of the idiom/phrase.
My father strained every nerve to enable me to get settled in life.
solution:
(a) worked very hard.

question:
Given below are four jumbled sentences. Pick the option that gives their correct order.
P. And Vasco Da Gama came to India in 1498.
Q. Europeans had long enjoyed spices imported from India by the Arabs, the Portuguese and the Spaniards.
R. They developed sea routes and navigational tools that made it easier for them to sail upon the open ocean.
S. They set out for India by going through the Atlantic Ocean, Christopher Columbus ended up in America in 1492.
solution:
(b) QRSP
Sentence Q will be the starting line as it contains the main idea of the parajumble i.e. Spices, imported from India. And, Sentence R states how they made it easy to import species. So, R will follow Q. Further, Sentence S states about Christopher who set out for India and Sentence P states about Vasco Da Gama, who came to India. So, P will follow S. Going through the options, option (b) has the correct sequence.

question:

An open space usually rectangular and enclosed in a building
solution:

Quintessential- representing the most perfect or typical example of a quality or class.
Quadruped- any animal that has four feet.

question: The app gets Larry‚Äôs parents involved in the learning and improvement process, sending them advice about Larry‚Äôs behaviours and progress, and recommending motivational _______ they might undertake that are _______ to Larry‚Äôs situation and the program‚Äôs _________ about his attitudes and behaviours.
solution: (c) Interventions means the action of becoming intentionally involved in a difficult situation, in order to improve it or prevent it from getting worse.And intervention is available in option c only so c is the correct answer.

question:

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
They propose to build a dam for irrigation purposes
option_2: For the irrigation purposes a dam has been built.
option_4: It is proposed to build a dam for irrigation purposes.
solution:

(a) Build a dam for irrigation purposes. (Tone has changed to authoritative)
(b) For the irrigation purposes a dam has been built. (Meaning has changed)
(c) Irrigation dam is built. (Meaning has changed)

question:
Choose the word opposite in meaning to the given word.
Relentless
solution:
(b) yielding
Relentless - for describing something that's harsh, unforgiving, and persistent,
(a) merciless - showing no mercy.
(c) monotonous - dull, tedious, and repetitious; lacking in variety and interest.
(d) incisive - (of a person or mental process) intelligently analytical and clear-thinking.

question:
Fill in the blank with most appropriate word
I am ______ of joining the armed forces.
solution:
(c) desirous
Desirous means wanting something very much. However, desirous always takes the preposition ‚Äòof‚Äô with it. The given sentence states that the narrator is desirous of joining the armed forces. Hence, ‚Äòdesirous‚Äô is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the given word.
Confound
solution:
(c) Discern- to recognize or understand something clearly.
Confound- to confuse or perplex someone.
Expire- to come to an end or cease to be valid.
Suppress- to prevent or restrain something.
Assure- to make someone feel certain or confident.

question:
Cloze test:
The postal service is the government agency (96)_________handles the mail. Its job is (97)________letters and packages to people and businesses all over the world. Its goal is to see that your mail gets to its destination (98)________ possible. People (99)_________ the postal service to deliver important letters and even valuables, (100)_________time and to the right person.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank number 96.
solution:
(d) that
‚ÄòThat‚Äô is used to introduce a new clause in a sentence. The given passage states that the postal service is the government agency that handles the mail(new clause). Hence, ‚Äòthat‚Äô is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test:
The postal service is the government agency (96)_________handles the mail. Its job is (97)________letters and packages to people and businesses all over the world. Its goal is to see that your mail gets to its destination (98)________ possible. People (99)_________ the postal service to deliver important letters and even valuables, (100)_________time and to the right person.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank number 97.
solution:
(d) to deliver
‚ÄòPreposition to + first form of the verb(V1)‚Äù is grammatically the correct structure for the given sentence which is in the present tense. Hence, ‚Äòto deliver(V1)‚Äô is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test:
The postal service is the government agency (96)_________handles the mail. Its job is (97)________letters and packages to people and businesses all over the world. Its goal is to see that your mail gets to its destination (98)________ possible. People (99)_________ the postal service to deliver important letters and even valuables, (100)_________time and to the right person.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank number 98.
solution:
(d) as quickly as
The phrase ‚Äòas quickly as‚Äô means as fast as you are able. The given passage states that its goal is to see that your mail gets to its destination as fast(quickly) as it is possible. Hence, ‚Äòas quickly as‚Äô is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test:
The postal service is the government agency (96)_________handles the mail. Its job is (97)________letters and packages to people and businesses all over the world. Its goal is to see that your mail gets to its destination (98)________ possible. People (99)_________ the postal service to deliver important letters and even valuables, (100)_________time and to the right person.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank number 99.
solution:
(d) rely on
The phrase ‚Äòrely on‚Äô means to need(someone or something) for support, help, etc. The given passage states that people rely on(need support of) the postal service to deliver important letters. Hence, ‚Äòrely on‚Äô is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test:
The postal service is the government agency (96)_________handles the mail. Its job is (97)________letters and packages to people and businesses all over the world. Its goal is to see that your mail gets to its destination (98)________ possible. People (99)_________ the postal service to deliver important letters and even valuables, (100)_________time and to the right person.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank number 100.
solution:
(d) on
The phrase ‚Äòon time‚Äô means not too late or too early, punctual. The given passage states that the postal service delivers important letters and even valuables on time. Hence, ‚Äòon‚Äô is the most appropriate answer.
